verb.description: Make a journey, typically of some length or abroad.
examples: the vessel had been traveling from Libya to Ireland

verb.description: (of an object or radiation) move, typically in a constant or predictable way.
Take more than the allowed number of steps (typically two) while holding the ball without dribbling it.

noun.description: The action of traveling, typically abroad.
examples: I have a job that involves a lot of travel

origin: Middle English: a variant of travail, and originally in the same sense.
